intro: Satyrium paludicola, commonly known as the marsh orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to wetland habitats in Europe. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, pale greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in peat bogs and damp meadows, where it thrives in nutrient-poor, acidic soils. Its unique morphology includes a slender stem and a single, erect flower with a distinctive lip. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, Satyrium paludicola is considered endangered in many regions.
